Hi!

You could try test the effect of calling this method. e.g if this method 
takes some param and changes the state of these prameter then try to 
test the expected state of these passed object after the method called. 
In case this method does not do any such thing, it must at be changing 
the object state. In that case after the method call, verify the 
integrity of these object varibles. If it is changes the state of 
private variables, then you could still see the values by using 
junit-addons or junix as I have said in my previous mail.

Regards,
Nagendra


rajeshwari_83 wrote:

> There is a class which has one public method returning an ArrayList.
> The public method of this class inturn calls several private methods
> which are void. These private methods only keep adding to the
> arraylist which is finally returned by the public method. I need to
> write a JUNIT for this class specifically the private methods of this
> class. Since these methods are void, how do I write JUNIT test cases
> for them???
>
>
